IX.iii.1.D.1.g
.
Income That Is Not Countable for Parents’ DIC
The following types of income are
not
countable for Parents’ DIC purposes:
income of children (children are not dependents on Parents’ DIC awards)
inheritances of property (as opposed to money)
the value of maintenance by a relative, friend, or organization
Welfare and Supplementary Security Income (SSI)
VA pension or compensation benefits
Servicemembers’ Group Life Insurance (SGLI), United States Government Life Insurance (USGLI), and National Service Life Insurance (NSLI) proceeds
proceeds of
casualty insurance policies up to the fair market value of the property immediately preceding the loss
cashed-in life insurance policies, and
cashed-in savings bonds
payments of a bonus or similar cash gratuity by any State based upon service in the Armed Forces
Social Security lump-sum death benefit
payments received under
the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act (RECA),
Public Law (PL) 101-426
section 103(c)(1) of the Ricky Ray Hemophilia Relief Fund Act of 1998
the Energy Employees Occupational Illness Compensation Program, and
the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act of 2020
payments to certain eligible Aleuts under
50 U.S.C. 4236
the value of an increase of stock inventory of a business
an employer’s contributions to health and hospitalization plans for either an active or retired employee
, and
any other payment excluded by statute.
References
:  For more information on
specific exclusions for Parents’ DIC countable income, see
38 CFR 3.261
, and
38 CFR 3.262
cashed-in savings bonds and life insurance policies, see
M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, 1.D.7.g
, and
payments specifically excluded by Federal statute, see
M21-1, Part IX, Subpart iii, 1.I.11
.
